Symptoms: Small, dark lesions expanding to large, dark spots with pale borders. White, velvety growth under humid conditions.
Conditions: Cool, moist environments, dew persistence, and high humidity favor lesion development.

Symptoms: Brown to black lesions at leaf attachments, elongating along stems, causing brittleness and breakage.
Conditions: High humidity encourages sporulation; mechanical stress increases breakage risks.

Symptoms: Irregular, sunken brown/purplish skin lesions with tan to reddish-brown granular rot extending into the tuber.
Conditions: Infection worsens with wet conditions and poor storage practices.
